title: How to Breed a Jeeode in My Singing Monsters: 5 Easy Steps

steps.title: Obtain some parent monsters.
steps.content: Obtain some parent monsters. Jeeode can be obtained by breeding a Shellbeat and any triple-element monster found on Water Island. However, the chance of getting a Jeeode is very low (about 1%) so you'll likely have to breed your monsters multiple times to get a Jeeode. [1] X Research source Some of the potential parents (besides a Shellbeat) could be: Spunge Pummel Scups Reedling

steps.title: Level the parents to level 4.
steps.content: Level the parents to level 4. Monsters must be at least level 4 to breed, so level up your parent monsters if they're not already at least level 4. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish.
steps.content: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish. While not necessary, you can upgrade your Breeding Structures to reduce breeding times by 25%. You can upgrade your structure by spending 25 diamonds. You can also add Wishing Torches around your Breeding Structure to help increase the odds of a rare monster being bred. [3] X Research source Wishing Torches can be lit for 24 hours by paying 2 diamonds or be lit permanently by paying 100 diamonds.

steps.title: Breed the parent monsters.
steps.content: Breed the parent monsters. Once you're ready to breed your monsters, put them in the Breeding Structure. A Jeeode egg is orange/red and looks crystalline, similar to a Jeeode. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for your Jeeode to hatch.
steps.content: Wait for your Jeeode to hatch. On Water Island, it will take 1 day and 12 hours to hatch, or 1 day and 3 hours if you've upgraded your breeding structure.
